body.p:
St Louis May 5th 1862
Edgar Keenon Esq
Dear Sir --

I allowed my term of office as Comr. for Ky. to Expire last fall or winter -- Will you please to call on Gov. Magoffin, or the Secretary of State & procure a new one & Give (Commission) for me -- I recd a note from the latter at the time notifying me when the term would Expire, but in the Excitement ^& uncertainty^ of the times, I omitted to renew it --
You will have to pay a fee to the Secretary, which I will remit to you the amount I get your answer & the Comn -- all well -- give our best love to H Henrietta, & kiss the Children

P.S. Tell the Gov. or rather the secretary of state for me that he has granted Commissions to two or thee D -- d abolitionists. -- who ought not to hold any position from a slave state -- tho. I am not much proud of Ky of late

Missouri
Comr. of Deeds
Basil Duke
St. Louis
Com Issd May 8. 1862
